intro: Plectrelminthus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored lichen, is a unique species that belongs to the family Peltigeraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive bi-colored thallus, typically featuring a dark upper layer and a lighter lower layer. This lichen thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on decaying wood or stone. Its structure consists of a symbiotic association between a fungus and algae or cyanobacteria, which allows it to carry out photosynthesis. The plant plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and serves as an indicator of air quality in its habitat.
